title: Using the definition of partial fraction decomposition
text: Since the denominator contains one linear factor and one irreducible quadratic factor, the numerator of the linear factor will be a constant (A), and the numerator of the quadratic factor will be a linear expression (e.g. Bx+C)
speech: Since the denominator contains one linear factor and one irreducible quadratic factor, the numerator of the linear factor will be a constant (A), and the numerator of the quadratic factor will be a linear expression (e.g. Bx+C)
pacedSpeech: Since the denominator contains one linear factor and one irreducible quadratic factor, the numerator of the linear factor will be a constant (A), and the numerator of the quadratic factor will be a linear expression (e.g. Bx+C)

title: Removing the denominator
text: Multiply both sides of the equation by the common denominator
speech: Multiply both sides of the equation by the common denominator
pacedSpeech: Multiply both sides of the equation by the common denominator

title: Finding the resulting equation
text: Expand the right side and combine like terms.
speech: Expand the right side and combine like terms.
pacedSpeech: Expand the right side and combine like terms.

title: Resulting equation
text: The resulting equation is: $$8x^2+12x-20=\left(A+B\right) x^2+\left(A+3B+C\right) x+2A+3C$$

title: Setting up the system of equations
text: Compare the coefficients of both sides, which will give rise to a system of equations in three variables.
